description: Students in this course gain a critical understanding of the economic implications of several forms of government regulation by studying antitrust, traditional regulation and topics in environmental, consumer, and workplace regulation. These different ways governments influence market outcomes are examined from both historical and economic perspectives. Prerequisite: one of Economics 110-121 or permission of instructor. Offered most years. Counts towards American studies major.
name: Bus, Govt & Marketpl
prerequisites: one of Economics 110-121 or permission of instructor. Offered most years. Counts towards American studies major.
